metadata.Title: CVE-2014-9556 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Integer overflow in the qtmd_decompress function in libmspack 0.4 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (hang) via a crafted CAB file, which triggers an infinite loop. It was discovered that cabextract incorrectly handled certain malformed CAB files. An attacker could use this issue to cause cabextract to hang, resulting in a denial of service.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-9556` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

cabextract - 1.6-1.1
No subscription required

libmspack0 - 0.4-3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: cabextract package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.6-1.1').
libmspack package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.4-3').
